meanings.definition: A unit of osmotic pressure equal to the pressure that would be exerted by a solution containing 1 mole of an ideal non-dissociating solute per liter of solution.
meanings.sent1: The scientist measured the osmole of the solution to understand its pressure.
meanings.sent2: The osmole of the saltwater solution indicated its strength.
meanings.sent3: The osmole in the beaker seemed to be playing a pressure game with the other molecules.
meanings.sent4: The osmole of knowledge in the room created a tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The osmole of the liquid pushed against the container walls, demonstrating its force.
